website_summaries.verdict: Great little grill to take with you on trips or to backyard parties. Quality built and simple to use. From a trusted long-standing grill company.
pros: Simple no-frills grill that does what it is meant to do
Super portable and easy to clean
Porcelain coating reduces rust for use over many seasons
Nice touch with the owner's guide, which comes with cooking tips and ideas
cons: Some issues with the air vent—ash has a tendency to clog airflow

website_summaries.verdict: An excellent choice for outdoor chefs who love to grill with charcoal, and want to take their craft when on the go. The budget-friendly price is also enticing.
pros: A compact charcoal grill that's very affordable, portable, and practical
Easy to use, clean, and transport
Offers reasonably sturdy construction for the price, plus an impressive 10-year warranty
cons: Air vent is prone to becoming clogged with ashes
Lid handle tends to get hot

customer_reviews.title: Much hotter cooking if you remove the top!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this great grill for about 3 years now.... works perfect! WAY better than a cheaper imitation grill. The one thing that was bugging me about it is that I couldn't keep the coals super hot.... now I know to open both vents all the way... and if it is still not enough heat or the heat is dying... just take off the top and it will get super hot with an open top air flow! Hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for when grilling for one or two as well as taking it to more than one location.
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the larger 22” one for a long time I wanted to have a smaller one that I could use when grilling just for me and this is perfect. In fact assembly is a breeze took minutes to put together. I’m able to use less charcoal with a little less depth between the charcoal grate and the grillling surface I can get away with 12-16 briquettes rather than 25-30 built into a hefty mound and it is small enough and light enough to allow it to be easily transported. The only flaw is the grilling rack doesn’t have any handle to lift it on and off but it is minor.
customer_reviews.author: Eff Ewe Leo

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect small grill
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for-small enough to be easily portable but still be able to grill a whole chicken or a rack of ribs. I have done both with excellent results. Sturdy construction, ease of cleaning and economical use of charcoal added benefits. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: h chapin

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest I had my doubts but it’s amazing. Perfect size it’s not that tall (and I wasn’t expecting it to be) but it’s perfect! I’m a huge fan of Baseball and getting to the stadium a few hours and be able to cook with this Weber grill it’s just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi T.

customer_reviews.title: such good little grills
customer_reviews.text: such good little grills, love it. So well sealed that you can shut the vents and reuse charcoal about 4 times with this.
customer_reviews.author: Corvetter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing capacity, well designed
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to assemble. Amazing capacity for small grill. Cooks evenly and fast. Only reason not 5 stars is there are no handles on the sides to assist with moving when hot. Otherwise amazing inexpensive well designed grill
customer_reviews.author: John Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: My husband doesn't like to grill but occasionally i like something grilled, so i bought this for myself. It's just the right size, easy to use, and easy to keep clean. I don't trust those wire bristle brushes, so i like being able to take this grill surface and wash it in the sink. So easy and worry-free. And now my husband has things he wants me to grill. Ahem.
customer_reviews.author: kphiker

customer_reviews.title: It's a Weber! How can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.text: At a cost of around $35 for a grill that will pretty much last a lifetime, there's not much negative to say. Easy to assemble, materials and coating are top notch. I use it as a companion to my pellet smoker for searing and cooking up burgers , sausage, and dogs. It's a great portable grill. The only negative is I wouldn't mind having a detachable tray to catch spent coal ashes. Highly recommended, never the less. A must-have for anyone that needs a portable, reliable, well built charcoal grill.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R

customer_reviews.title: Where are the handles?
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect size to travel with and weber grills are fairly durable. It can definitely cook food for multiple people at once. I don’t like that it has no handles so once its hot it cannot be moved. You have to wait for it to get cold or use oven mitts to dump the coal which can be dangerous. The instructions were just a few pictures so i had my brother figure it out. It only took 5-10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: The old smokey Joe
customer_reviews.text: What more to say, assembles in about 10 minutes max and delivers the same quality that Weber has always been known for in a much smaller and portable form factor. I've got no negatives here, I would say be generous on the amount of coals that you use, this takes a decent amount to really get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Username Taken

customer_reviews.title: Not built like they use to be!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these 20 years ago and It finely gave up. So I bought another one. As it seems, so many things you buy now days have cheapened, this is no different. The handle is plastic instead of wood and the coating on the unit chips. We have used it 2 times, the last time my husband dropped the lid from a distance of a foot and now we have two big paint chips that have fallen off and it is already rusting. My husband dropped the old lid repeatedly and it never lost any paint. Disappointed but not surprised
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: No nuts to attach legs, useless.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this grill after going to a state park and finding there were no available grills. We received the grill quickly but did not have any reason to open it until three days after the return window closed. We opened the box on our son's birthday to put it together before going to the beach for the day and found there were no nuts and bolts to attach the legs. The grill is useless.
customer_reviews.author: GEArHEAd

customer_reviews.title: Great small foot print option for empty nesters
customer_reviews.text: It's big enough to grill for two without the waste you would have with a full size Weber. Once I got used to using charcoal again and learned how to time the delay of getting to the proper temp it has been a simple process. The big advantages to me are portability and ease of cleanup. I leave the grill out overnight to cool down, dump the cold ash into a trash bag and use the hose to wash it out. I also scrape off what burnt on gunk I can and then use a ScotchBrite pad and soap and water to finish the job. Then everything goes into the garage until the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance L. McCann

customer_reviews.title: Small + High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the small size of this grill. The price point is excellent, and would work perfect on the back porch of an apartment. I use it as a table top grill in my backyard and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Gage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small household
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a decent charcoal grill (isn't the taste always better?) that was small enough for 1 or 2 people, but still good looking with a good price. Boy did I get the right one. My little Smokey Joe is great looking, didn't cost an arm & a leg, is very sturdy but I can carry it easily. It cooks a mean burger & cleanup is so easy. If you are looking for this type of grill, you can't go wrong with the Smokey Joe.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: So, my nephew got one and we were able to use it before buying one. Bonus for us. It’s super easy to assemble and the size is good. My wife and I love it cause it’s portable. We use about a half of a bag of charcoal when using it. I would recommend it for cookouts at the park camping or home. We are a family of three so it works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Niles Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love my Smokey Joe😎
customer_reviews.text: An awesome product and a really great buy, a must have for those quick trips. Arrived on time, all parts are new and included just wish the lid would have a hook to rest the lid on the side. We've already used this twice within a week
customer_reviews.author: Johnny G!

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat! I cook for my family of four with this little guy. Great flavors all around.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Value for money, but...
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy it again. I would instead purchase the 18-inch with lower side vents, a carrying handle - even when hot - and a more easily removable ash tray. I didn't pay enough attention when buying this one. It's small and cute, works fine except for its portability while hot and cleanup, which is unnecessarily cumbersome compared to the other versions. Get the Jumbo Joe. It's a little more expensive but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Limey Smokejumper

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little grill!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this small size Weber to complement the 22" Weber Kettle grill we recently purchased. If we are just grilling for two of us than we will just use the small one. Webers are terrific, I remember my father buying one back in the 70's and he used it for many years. We had considered some others like the big green egg, one's with smokers, etc.. but resolved to the fact that we mostly use it for grilling Hamburgers, Sausages, Steaks and Hot Dogs so this would work great. I even built a wooden grill station for it similar to the ones you can see on Pinterest. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Good quality kettle grill
customer_reviews.text: Not a large grill but large enough to cook 4 leg and thigh quarters at once with a bit of extra space. Easy to control how much heat you want with the vents on the top and bottom. Seals well so when finished you can close the vents to smother the coals allowing them to be relit for next time if they are not fully consumed while cooking. If you don’t need a large cooking surface but want the charcoal flavor this a great little grill.
customer_reviews.author: RglrJoe

customer_reviews.title: E Z assembly
customer_reviews.text: I have had smokey Joes in the past, and they always perform well, have not used this one yet. This is the first I have had t assemble, different age I guess. 3 star rating is based on how easy it is to put together 5 star, how durable these are 4 Star, cost and lack of side handles are minus points as well. As far as a small table top, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Maui wowie

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY THE GRILL I WAS LOOKING FOR...
customer_reviews.text: This grill is wonderful. It’s not heavy, bulky and very easy to use. Since the grill arrived at my doorstep, I have used it almost daily. I’m an older women and it’s very easy for me to handle. I like grilled food and my other half works all the time, so I went looking for a grill I could handle. This grill fit every aspect. Now, I’m able to prep the charcoal and lighter ( I got my self a mini chimney) and my grilling skills are unsurpassed. “My grill” has a special place on our porch.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 years ago to the day and I'm sitting here getting some charcoal going and figured I'd kill some time and write a little review. I leave this out in the rain all the time - still kicking and barely any rust. Almost never clean it beyond dumping out the ashes - still gets the job done as good and as fast as it did on day one. Enough space to get 2 steaks done with a 1/2 and 1/2 high and low heat zone setup. If it ever junks out on me I'll be sure to get this model again.
customer_reviews.author: The Anjow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little grill for 2-4 people
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! We have a full sized gas grill but I just miss the charcoal burgers I grew up with so we got this. It can fit about 6 burgers on it which is perfect for just me and my husband or when we have my parents over. Only complaint is that the lid doesn’t really secure onto the grill so the slightest bump knocks it off
customer_reviews.author: Zaneta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: A nice sized grille for home but better for traveling. Which is why I purchased it. Doesn't take up much room and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Package was left in driveway on retaining wall
customer_reviews.text: This delivery was a sham. The box says plain as day Weber grill. The delivery notification is an outright fabrication. The delivery woman rang my doorbell and ran back to the vehicle. I have her on tape. I could have been out and away, it would have been easy pickins for any theft. This is the second time the delivery note said "delivered to resident" and that was false.
customer_reviews.author: GrandMaRain

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little grill that could!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's as sturdy as any other Weber grill, and it's the perfect size if you're looking for something totally portable. My wife and I have used this when we were grilling at our campsite in the Smoky Mountains, and it grilled up some beef and pork perfectly when we were at Mackinaw City. I mean, it goes everywhere, it's small enough that it doesn't eat up that much space, and again, it's Weber, so you know you're getting a quality piece of hardware. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: boots2passes

customer_reviews.title: Best lil grill ever!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to assemble No tools needed Strong and sturdy Saves on wasting charcoal Perfect for a small family Cons: None yet! I love this little grill. It is very easy to put together. No tools needed. It's strong and sturdy. It saves on wasting charcoal. We are a family of 3. This lil Weber is perfect for cooking a meal for us. It can fit 7 bubba burgers at a time. I've cooked steaks, burgers, hotdogs, brawts, pork chops, veggies, and so much more on this little grill
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Classic grill
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé refused to buy any grill other than a Weber grill (I've never been very attached to brand names) but I do really like this! I was worried we would end up spending 100$+ on a grill but this thing was super inexpensive and works great. I was initially worried that the size wouldn't fit our needs, but we recently had a 4-person cookout and the size was perfect. I do think that any more people would require extra batches of cooking, but not terrible considering we rarely will need to cook for more than 4 people. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Howell

customer_reviews.title: Durable, even heating
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Smokey Joe's for well decades, they last, cook evenly, and you can just put in the back of the car for a cookout anywhere. I usually get four or five years life out of the grill and that is leaving it out in the elements. I plan on taking better care of this unit and the life will increase. I highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Kemper G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grill
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I could say about this perfect little Weber that hasn't already been said. I have many grills and smokers, but the one I use almost every day is this 14 inch, Smokey Joe. Just add GrillGrates, and it will even be more perfect. Easy to start and very efficient with the charcoal. I just came back from a camping trip, and it cooked enough food for three grown men faultlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Perry R.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Grill there is, fast easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Hartville Tool Company did a GREAT JOB !! Very Fast Delivery!! Another Weber Smokey Joe in the Family. Best little Grill you can use, they last forever and all Ace Hardware Stores carry any and all parts. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Mason

customer_reviews.title: made in chinatown
customer_reviews.text: well I know it is only 35.00 but you would think the grill would fit, well maybe when the weber CEO gets his bonus, from all the money they made from shipping all the jobs to chinatown he will buy one of these and see the grill is to small for the body!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's small as expected and nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Really like this grill. It works as advertised. I have two complaints though. 1. It would be nice if the lid had a hanger where it could rest on the side of the grill. 2. The ash tray is attached so it makes it difficult to actually get the ash out of the bottom. Have to bounce it a little. Easily can cook for four on it. It holds 5 burgers without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great portability but limited versatility
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to control the heat, bought it for portability but you need a real kettle of a gas grill if you wanna do some precise cooks. Great for camping and serving simple food but I immediately embraced grilling after buying it and quickly realized I had to upgrade to take my skills to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Fer Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great small grill
customer_reviews.text: A baby Weber ? NOOOOOOOOO ! It's a WEBER. I originally bought this to pimp out a Brinkman ... But, this is a high quality grill for 2. It does almost everything the big Weber does. But, it's smaller... I can roast a whole chicken in it but, The chicken needs to be split in half. This is a great small grill ... Perfect for camping, tailgating, and for a family of 2.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Weber portable grills...is there another brand?
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has been on a ton of camping trips this year and holds up just as you'd expect a mini Webber to. We usually buy one of these every 4-5 years after we've run the other one into the ground. We already shoved some heavy camping gear on top of this and crushed a leg. No worries. Just pulled it back into position with a bit of elbow grease and its good as new again. We always come back to these little Webers when we abuse the last one a bit too much so we'll be back again.
customer_reviews.author: Breezer

customer_reviews.title: Love weber grills
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 other Weber grills and love them. So we ordered a smaller one for quick grilling thinking that we wouldn't use as much charcoal. It's a great size and can accommodate 4-5 burgers, great for 2 people. Although it didn't really save much charcoal we still use it. Weber makes great products and this would be good for people with limited space.
customer_reviews.author: K Stan

customer_reviews.title: Small and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift to my parents in Rio/Brazil. Small, perfect size for 2-3 people. They loved it because their patio can be quite windy and it made it a lot easier to get the charcoal going. Their brick grill is too large, good for family gathering, so Smokey Joe turned out to be a great alternative for the 2 of them without making a huge mess.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Easy grilling !
customer_reviews.text: Great for quick and easy grilling ! My steak tasted like the stuff from restaurants . I love it ! Plan on using this for kbbq with my friend sitting around the grill ! Watch out for sharp edges and handle carefully ! Other than that amazing product !
customer_reviews.author: Jaryd

customer_reviews.title: A reliable domed grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill was a replacement for a Smoky Joe that I bought in 1996. I used it very frequently, and it served for more than two decades before rust ate through the bottom part. For the money, this is an excellent grill. The new grill has a number of improvements, such as a molded polystyrene handle that will not crack or split like the old wooden ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Strange

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little grill!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so that I could do some grilling for myself and my girlfriend. Easy to put together, well made, instructions are clear and the grilling guide is a great addition. You will be a pro in no time. Word of advice: The two vents are riveted on. Make sure you move them back and forth to loosen them before you use the grill, especially the bottom one. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: DaSanti1

customer_reviews.title: you are missing one of the most amazing things in nature
customer_reviews.text: Use this as my surf fishing grill. You can get a fire going and then use a cast iron frying pan on top of the surface area to cook breakfast on the beach. Ever smelled bacon cooking on the beach mixed with the salty air? If you have not, you are missing one of the most amazing things in nature. I love this little grill. portable, easy to light, and cooks a mean steak and eggs breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Used this grill for many meals, works perfectly. ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this grill for many meals, works perfectly. Wanted a smaller grill for just “2 of Us” cook outs. Because it’s small, my gumption to clean after each use, is now able to follow thru. No matter what $$ you spend on a grill if it ain’t clean before each use, your cook out won’t reach its top potential.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Osgood

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cute Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Just used it 1st time yesterday y loved it! Made perfect hamburgers y it's so cute! Just adore it! Just used it again y I do so very much love it. It's the cutest y best lil grill a girl could have who wanted charcoal. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia StarGypsy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grill, But No Lock Bar for Top
customer_reviews.text: The older model used to have a bar that locked the top on. This one however does not. That was a nice feature because it allowed you to pick up the grill with one hand while it was still hot. Other than that, it's a great little grill.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Harris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good Grill - Damaged on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it a low rating due to the fact that the grill came damaged. The Top was chipped and had a slight dent in it. Probably was sent back this way from a previous purchaser. My husband is frustrated but wants to keep it anyway. I’m against it, but we’ve waited awhile for it and he wants to use it for his birthday weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Jackson Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Bang For Your Buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: The fact that someone would knock this grill when it only costs $30 is beyond me. Very very high quality for the price. I use it for camping and I foresee it lasting a long time. Even if I had to buy a new one every year it would be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: richard plecenik

customer_reviews.title: Love the grill but
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill but, wish it would have come with handles. Does anyone know if handles are available for purchase?
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Yost

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Pro's - Assembly is ok - Sturdy build - Cool look - Portable Cons - you will need a few screwdrivers - extra washer with no explanation - could have been cheaper Neat summer grill very hard to clean
customer_reviews.author: htxotis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Not “portable” yet it IS because it’s small enough.
customer_reviews.text: All around great. Very sturdy and is just great, if you buy one you will surly love it. There’s not much to elaborate on. It’s not exactly “portable” as the legs doesn’t fold in like some cheaper grills but it’s small enough that leg folding isn’t needed, it easily goes in a trunk or truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for Price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when we picnic at the park, bonfire at the beach, or fish at the pier. Easy to use, easy to clean. The handle stays cool when you use the lid to suffocate the fire. Great quality, especially considering the price. I only have 2 critiques: 1) the legs are always bent out of shape (so fix them before you light the fire), and 2) there's no easy way to carry all the pieces at once (so I usually just use bungee cords to tie the handle/lid to the legs at the base—problem-solved). Other than that, this thing is awesome; I've even taken it camping.
customer_reviews.author: KJI

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on arrival but usable
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the grill yet, but the silver catch tray came with a big visible dent/bend in it. Returning it would have been a pretty big hassle, and the dent doesn't appear to affect the usability of the grill. Still, it was frustrating to see that the product was damaged on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Karly

customer_reviews.title: Just another piece of my Weber addiction, perfect mini for tailgating
customer_reviews.text: These Webber grills are the best thing in the world to bbq with, they have a cult following. I own a couple of the extra large ones but found it inconvenient to who use that much charcoal as well as packet for trips if I was just cooking for me in the life. This one cooks perfect still and is in a much smaller package.
customer_reviews.author: Justin w

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome little grill. I've needed a grill for a long time and settled on this one because it's small and cost less than traditional grills but does the same job as the larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: C. Eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Webber Grill
customer_reviews.text: Weber makes great grills... and even this "little Smokey" is a good example of their quality. One son brings this camping... but it is a bit cumbersome for backpacking. Better for apartment grilling, college fun, car camping, other small grilling meals. Not a lot of room on the grill, but perfect for just a few people - 1 to 5 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my deck
customer_reviews.text: I love my Weber, seriously! I find any excuse to be outside and bbq! It’s the perfect size for my deck. I have a table that I put the Weber on so it stands hip high so I’m not bending over. My boyfriend and I are still trying to figure out the top and bottom air vents as we’re bbq first timers! We’re working on it but, it’s been a joy!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Best grill big or small is always a Weber!
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill for any gathering. Work potluck, picnic, lake, camping, you name it. Has the great Weber ventalation system to allow more or less air flow, pending the results you are looking for. Gets charcoal ready faster than most other styles, by far! Highly recommend for them last minute get always or that piece of camping equipment that never leaves the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Moe

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and quick set-up
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy assembly. Needed a charcoal small barbecue set for a my fiance and to cook on and take on camping trips. This was the perfect size as we can transport easily and have a fast set up for convenience - this definitely does the job and met our needs. Highly recommended if you're looking for a mobile barbecue set and cooking for a small family, this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Lai Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping - too small for a family.
customer_reviews.text: Made well, works great, she real small though! All the quality you'd expect from a Weber. I put two full size steaks on the grate but heat management is rough, it just doesn't make much. I stepped up to the bigger grill after about a month. If I wanted a shop grill or a backup/portable model, this would be my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Omfgzombies!

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product with decent portability.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built very nice grill. The only beef I have with the product is it's portability. It would be nice if it had fold up legs or at least some latches that hold the lid on so it can be easily picked up and moved, considering I bought this for camping it would be nice if it had better portability. Other than this I would highly recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sumguy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the money compared to the cheaper version found here on Amazon. As a single person, this grill is the perfect size you can even cook a meal of you are a couple as well. You don't have to use a ton of charcoal to grill a few burgers or hot dogs. It's very sturdy and portable to use anywhere. I am very happy with the weber grill.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Solid little grill
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my RV and have done steaks, chicken and corn on it. It's not meant for a primary grill but for a couple, or for camping and RV travel this is a solid grill that does a great job on the food.
customer_reviews.author: slammer

customer_reviews.title: We have 2!
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with the one we purchased because it had no handle on it as was displayed. The seller refunded promptly and said to keep it anyway. We used it and Loved it!!! We then purchased another later that did have the handles we needed for use in camping. The first one, I still use at home. Love the product and the seller!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome!! Bought for my husband who has been wanting a grill for ages. We live in an apartment, so this is the perfect size for apartment living. It's simple and basic and makes oh so tasty food!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable grill
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this father last day gift. Portable convenient cooled down fast after we were done and we bought the super nice Weber case cover that has a strap handle to transport
customer_reviews.author: Erica J. Light

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for camping and beach!
customer_reviews.text: Great little travel grill. Use it often for cooking on the beach. Great heat and grilling capabilities - Weber are hands down the best grills. Only negative is I wish there was a way to secure the lid to the base for traveling (like a latch). Used bungee cords but with only mediocre results as it kept slipping off. Overall great grill!
customer_reviews.author: cjp007

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is the first charcoal grill I have owned in years. It is easy to assemble and easy to store. The food just tastes better cooked on this little charcoal grill. Sure am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Levoyd Whitton

customer_reviews.title: Silver Model Not Enough Ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Well made grill, but it has a ventilation problem either caused by vent's distance from charcoal or fact ashes clog airflow. The grill is fine for quick stuff like hot dogs or burgers, but if you cook stuff like chicken that needs 30-60 minutes charcoal dies. I know some people design a coffee can with holes or drill holes in grill, but I expected something better from Weber. I switched to the son of hibachi. I'd go with the gold or think about a hibachi style if you cook stuff that takes longer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Smokey Joe is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, but nothing fancy needed for what I use this grill for. Perfect sized grill for tailgating or camping cooking to serve 3-4 people. Good for grilling hot dogs, burgers and anything else simple. Fits easily in the trunk of my car and doesn't take up a ton of space. It took me a couple of uses to figure out the optimal amount of charcoal and airflow for optimal cooking, but that is probably more operator related. Assembly took me about 10-15 minutes and no special tools needed.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Good Small Grill
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Weber grills 'forever' and have very good luck with them. I had the first Weber for 18 years before I had to replace it. I've also tried some (one or two) cheaper grills and they were very flimsy, didn't last long. I'll stay with Weber from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill! It is just the right size for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Grill! It is just the right size for the two of us. I don't waste charcoal because I can shut off the dampers and the charcoal goes out for use next time.
customer_reviews.author: Danco

customer_reviews.title: Our Summer 2020 companion
customer_reviews.text: Loved grilling with this little guy. It is small but very portable and can accommodate enough meat for 4 people. We used it a lot in parks here in NYC during covid pandemic and it was our summer saver.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo

customer_reviews.title: Great quick way to grill
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase. Works very well and cleans up nicely. Update: .I'm not using it very much because I can't get it not enough to sear meat. I've' gone online to try to learn how better to use it, but I'm certainly not there yet. Also, part of my rationale for switching from a propane grill was the cost of the 1lb.propane tanks. Imagine my dismay when I went to buy charcoal!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: this a great bbq, would have given 5 stars, but I feel the vents on the bottom are inconveniently located. Easy to burn yourself when trying to open or close them. Other wise, its great
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Small and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This small, portable grill has worked great for me. I originally bought a similar but cheaper model of a different brand and was disappointed when it broke after just a couple of uses. This Smokey Joe grill was a little pricier (but still so reasonable!), but I was very glad I paid the extra money. I've used it multiple times and the food has turned out great. It's also super lightweight and easy to transport and clean. You can easily fit 5 or 6 burgers on it at a time, so it's great for small gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: Janell Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Weber can’t be beat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an off brand, kept under cover but after one summer the bottom had rusted out. I have a larger Weber that I e had for years that has been exposed to weather and still hasn’t rusted so I ordered this one for our camper. I am not disappointed! Weber is a great brand. I will be a loyal customer for life now!
customer_reviews.author: Lori G.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and the charcoal dies out quickly when you close the top and bottom vents. You can grill chicken on this unit if you leave the lid on while cooking. If you want to grill steaks or burgers it's better to keep the lid off in order to get a nice hot fire while cooking. Works great for roasting marshmallows too. The size makes it just right for sitting atop the grate on those old school park grills. This unit is very portable and the lid can be secured to the bottom with a bungee cord and clasping underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill, it works really well and is very low maintenance. It was a great price and it really does get the job done. Compared to other grills I've purchased in the past I believe this one truly rises to the top. Really great for summer too!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Rae

customer_reviews.title: Was as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: After a couple decades of service, we managed to break the air vents on our small Weber grill. The replacement is almost identical and works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a Smokey Joe years ago and when that died, after roughly 10 years of intense service, we have been buying some cheaper ones that last 2-3 years each, and in the end probably ended up being more expensive... Now I had enough. Ready for another 10 years on a Smokey Joe..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and tastes great
customer_reviews.text: Love my small charcoal grill! Not a grill master by any means, but I was able to heat my charcoal with a chimney and cook both swordfish and veggie skewers with ease. Set up was simple. I wouldn't call it conveniently portable (requires time to cool and two hands), but I suppose it's more portable than a full size grill. I would recommend this grill to anyone looking to start out or with minimal storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fair price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, perfect for small family, good price, not the price before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshoper

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down from me dog
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to light, the food was never enjoyable. I have since donated it to good will because it just wasn't worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Parkent

customer_reviews.title: Smokey Joe 14" grill rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Weber Smokey Joe to keep onboard our travel trailer. I've owned Weber grills through the years and this does not disappoint. It is perfect for 2-3 people, uses a dozen or so briquets to cook whatever you desire. After grilling, just shut off the vents and you will have a few briquets left for the next time. I use the Smokey Joe Bag #7154 to store it in, fits easily inside our underneath storage in the travel trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Weber Grill
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. I have the large Weber Grill and I also had a portable Grill that I had for about 18 years and it did me well, but after the long run it was over. So, I got the portable Weber Grill and I love it. It is a smaller version of the larger one. Great DEAL.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette James

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Useful.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to someone else but they love it. Perfect for apartments, travel, tailgating, etc. Remarkable grill surface for a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Life Out Loud

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Smokey Joe in the past and it lasted for years! It took less than 5 minutes to assemble and is perfect when we're grilling for the two of us.
customer_reviews.author: scarpie

customer_reviews.title: does what it needs to.  They should have used silicon instead of plastic for the handle
customer_reviews.text: everything works but silicon for the handle instead of plastic would have been substantially better as it would not transfer heat like the plastic still does.
customer_reviews.author: jtown82

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: I have had Weber grills before. They've all been the best charcoal grills I've ever used. I've had the Smokey Joe grills before and, living alone, the Smokey Joe is just the right size and I love the flavor that charcoal gives the food. Great, great, little grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jerre Peak

customer_reviews.title: Little Weber, Big Results
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the big Weber Kettle, but downsizing made it impractical to keep. This little Smokey Joe does just fine, precisely what you expect from a Weber product, and I am a longtime Weber Fan. I use it at home, but it fits easily into the trunk of my car if we are picnicking. Would certainly work for tailgating as well. It is another, smaller, terrific Weber Product. Can easily BBQ 6 burgers or 4-5 large chicken breasts, so it serves well for small parties or small families. Space constraints? This Smokey Joe will make you NOT miss the big Kettle as much.
customer_reviews.author: IrishDee

customer_reviews.title: best small grill
customer_reviews.text: perfect for cooking for two, and close the vents, and save your charcoal! of course you have to add some each time. also cools off too hot fires. my next try is to smoke ribs, bet they'll be juicy and tender!
customer_reviews.author: OkieSenior

customer_reviews.title: Only one my husband will use
customer_reviews.text: We have had 6 or more of these. They are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Roane

customer_reviews.title: Some issues
customer_reviews.text: Grill has some issues. The handle gets very hot to the point where you need to use a pot holder. The dome is too shallow for all bit the thinnest food items. The bottom air vent is very hard to operate. The legs are made of very thin aluminum and they bend quite easily. If you are looking for something portable, like to take tailgating, note the dome doesn't have any locking device to the base. The fire bowl is thick enough to handle very hot fires. For the price it's OK
customer_reviews.author: Chef Biswanger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small grill
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, excellent quality, great deal and fast shipping. Weber grills are obviously the best and this tiny guy is no exception. I live in an apartment complex so this thing is great for the courtyard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware otherwise a great item.
customer_reviews.text: I love weber charcoal grills, and have always been satisfied until this purchase. The grill is still great, but the hardware package was missing the screw to attach the plastic handle to the top of the lid. I called weber and they sent a new hardware package to the house within a week. That hardware package was also missing the same screw. I finally took the handle to the local hardware store and found a screw that fulfilled my needs for less than $1.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Excellent great cooking one thing they should add is temp gauge but it's np I will add my self overall amazing I made my money with two amazing barbcue already very happy highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: rubab rahman

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy! Not a quality Weber product anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a lot flimsier then it used to be. This is not my first smokey joe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. We keep it outdoors. The first one lasted many years before rusting out. Cooks reliably for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: The Rev. R. Kingsbury Chase

product_meta.title: Weber 10020 Smokey Joe 14-Inch Portable Grill,Black
product_meta.description: Load up the car and hit the road with your Smokey Joe portable charcoal grill. Its durable, lightweight, compact design is perfect for grilling on the go - whether walking to the beach or taking a road trip. Make your holiday at the beach even more enjoyable with this Weber 14" Smokey Joe Charcoal Grill. This portable, go-anywhere grill is ideal for cooking up steaks, chops, vegetables, chicken or small roasts. Great for picnics and tailgate parties. This compact sized grill has three aluminum legs and an aluminum ash catcher. The Weber Smokey Joe charcoal grill has a durable rust-resistant construction with porcelain-enameled bowl and lid. Throw some charcoal in and toss the meat on the plated steel cooking grate for the perfectly cooked and great tasting grilled food. The no-rust aluminum vents of this Weber 14" Smokey Joe Charcoal Grill, controls air flow. It also has a 1-glass reinforced nylon handle that help protect your hands from the heat. This Smokey Joe charcoal grill can be easily assembled and cleaned.Weber 14" Smokey Joe Charcoal Grill, Black: Durable, rust-resistant construction Assembled Dimensions: 14.5"L x 14.25"W x 17"H Weber Smokey Joe silver charcoal grill has a 14" diameter cooking area Porcelain-on-steel finish inside and out Grill frame has 3 three aluminum legs with an aluminum ash catcher Heavy, bright nickel-plated steel cooking grate Smokey Joe charcoal grill with steel charcoal grate 1-glass reinforced nylon handle No rust aluminum vents for airflow control 10-year limited warranty Also available in Wal-Mart stores Model No. 10020 For more information about this Weber product, please call 1-800-446-1071
feature_bullets: Holds up to five burgers made with a Weber burger press
Compact and lightweight for grilling on the go
Porcelain-enameled lid and bowl retain heat, and won’t rust or peel
Dampers allow you to easily control the temperature inside your grill
Durable plated steel cooking grate retains heat and is easy to clean. Dimensions - Lid closed 17 H x 14.2 W x 14.5 D inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
